page.title: 10ENVIRONMENT
page.content: {The}skeleton of industry Around us lies with scars, And the once thriving human race Is gradually being forgotten. Taken is the ploughman's horse, Taken are the farms, And all of this has been replaced By speedy motor cars. { By}tractors, modern housing estates, Milking machines for churns, And oh! for the love of the Countryside How many people yearn? A peaceful beach, a tranquil place Is just for local folk; But the technology of the '80's With computers it has spoke. {The}slowness of the country folk Has been speeded up. As the 'Chevington Lady' digs And the protests carry on, And the power station will come.
